instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state but no power
threads.message:
Clean board nothing visible at all, came in before but we could not replicate problem and gave it back to customer, now it came back and finally it is not starting up.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.56v 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> is 5.1v

But no power

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state but no power
threads.message:
"came in before but we could not replicate problem"
Which was that problem reported by client?

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors.
Try known good BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 state but no power
threads.message: Looks like this board received some heat near or on the CPU, going back to customer now.
